statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Kareem South had 21 points and Myles Smith nailed five from distance for 17 points while dishing out eight assists as Texas A&M-Corpus Christi ran out to an early lead and coasted to an 81-63 win over NAIA's Huston-Tillotson on Tuesday night.
article.headline: South has 21 points, leads Texas A&M-CC to 81-63 victory
article.linkText: South has 21 points, leads Texas A&M-CC to 81-63 victory
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas -- Kareem South had 21 points and Myles Smith nailed five from distance for 17 points while dishing out eight assists as Texas A&M-Corpus Christi ran out to an early lead and coasted to an 81-63 win over NAIA's Huston-Tillotson on Tuesday night. Emmanuel Toney was 3 of 5 from long range to total 10 points for Texas A&M-Corpus Christi (5-5), which halted a three-game skid. The Islanders never trailed, taking a 31-15 lead midway in the first half to go ahead 46-28 at the break. Texas A&M-CC drained 9 of 15 from distance in the first half and finished hitting 14 of 29 (48 percent) while limiting the Rams to 8 of 26 from beyond the arc. Christian Wilson had 26 points with six rebounds and five assists to lead Huston-Tillotson.
